lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Woof, woof!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Arsenio now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Woof, woof, woof. '92 in the house!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were three. Anyway, before we get into tonight's session, we do have a few announcements, beginning with our fantastic sponsors of campaign two, and hopefully to infinity, D&D Beyond! Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond! Everybody, as all of you already know, before I became an actor, I was a professional ventriloquist.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is on your arm?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (clears throat) Oh Yondi, D&D Beyond is a great company, isn't it? (high-pitched voice) "They're "very charitable!" Shit. This is going to not be good. "They're very charitable; they're nice to "the dregs of society." Oh? Why do you say that? "They're nice to you, aren't they?" Ooh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Yondi!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh yeah? Imagine if you had a hand up your ass!" I've got

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you look up ventriloquist jokes online?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. Maybe, maybe. Let's talk about D&D Beyond, okay, Yondi? "Okay. People say using D&D "Beyond makes you a smarter player." Oh yeah,

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Best of show flashes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "You're hard to please." Oh, Yondi, please. You're not making Travis laugh at all. He doesn't find this amusing at all. "Oh, figures. Tra--" (laughs) Fucking shit!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're committed! Do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get it out, get it out!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Figures. You know how to make Travis laugh on a Thursday night?" How? "Tell him a joke on "Monday!" Because he's dumb!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've had enough. I really just need to tell people where to sign up for D&D Beyond. "No, what "you really need is a breath mint." Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sweating?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, guys, sign up today at D&D Beyond! "And report Sam Riegel to PuppetAbuse.org!" Thank you, Yondi, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was so bad!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, Yondi. Never come back. Yondi, never come back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a lot to un-alpaca there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Taliesin, no!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tune in next week, when Sam Riegel will stick his dick into a woodchipper!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This escalation is getting dangerous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just lost so many votes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did. You really did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Presidency is in jeopardy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got a week to make it up. Thank you, Sam. I'm sorry, D&D Beyond.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ventriloquist humor. We went there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Liam O'Brien for change you can believe in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Man, I don't know how to follow that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think you do. I think we come back next week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think that's it, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I skipped several jokes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, you merciful man!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well done!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. We are excited to announce that Critical Role will now be using the official D&D Beyond Twitch extension starting this week. It is now available to view while watching Critical Role live, in a browser only, however. All you have to do is mouse over the screen to see the information from each character. To get a detailed look at how the extension works, please go to critrole.com for information on how to get that all set up. It has live updates from their devices throughout the show, so don't mess it up, guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't yell at us if we get stuff wrong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No promises.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Join us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, the inside of that alpaca stinks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why did you smell the inside of the alpaca?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can smell my hands!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ew, gross! Go wash your hands!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does it taste like? Get your tongue out and taste the tip of your finger! Do it now! Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe you can drink out of its ass at the next live show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis, I believe you have an announcement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. (gibbering) Guys, we are mere days away from our Kickstarter launch of our very first animated special! My god, three days away. We thought it'd be cool to share some information about the special with you right now. Little sneak peek. First, the title. We are calling it The Legend of Vox Machina. It is in canon, and it takes place before our streaming game started. All of our characters will be right around level seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And alive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're echoing everything that we've been wanting for the past two and a half years. We can't bring this animated venture, The Legend of Vox Machina, to life without you. Please stay tuned to our social media accounts and our website for more information on the big launch that's coming on Monday!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Monday, Monday, Monday.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Travis. Need an alpaca to finish up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might, I might. Do you have any other puppet farm animals that you haven't abused yet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (high-pitched voice) I don't! (normal voice) Oh, that's Nott's voice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're about to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Diggin' deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We left off with you leaving the city of Asarius to take a break in the wilds in the outskirts of the city. That's where we begin tonight. As you guys prepare to rest for the night, is there anything you want to do or prepare, or anything in particular? Or are we going to take a night's sleep and then pick up in the morning?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't like the way you said that. It was far too casual. What's on the other side of this, Matt? Tell us now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're sleeping--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yelling gibberish)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Somebody should keep watch, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take first watch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will put up the dome and the silver wire and leave my cat on top of the dome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most of you get a rest. Fjord, you have first watch. Roll a perception check for me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not a problem. 13.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better than it's been.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Why are you bringing up old shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First watch, as you begin paying attention to the surrounding darkness of the sunless wastes, nothing occurs. You arrive nice and safe. You do see the shifting firelight of the dozens of torches being carried through the front lines of this army. You do see some now moving eastward, sections of that massive crew of soldiers and warbeasts. Elements of that seem to be moving east-- or, westward from this position. No other issues during your rest, so you complete your evening's sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll relay it to whoever takes my spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoever's taking next watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take next.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a perception check for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you keep an eye over the surrounding shadows and the faint elements of softened moonlight that seems to punch through elements of the clouds passing overhead and gently highlight the shapes in the distant horizon across these wastes, nothing seems to catch your attention. Though the rain has somewhat stopped for the evening, and there's a bit of calm and silence, which is comfortable and preferable for you at this juncture.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit. Fuck!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's been some time!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Wet dreams!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down, eyes blinking, to see foam and briny seawater now slowly soaking into the hard-packed ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Fjord, are you all right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (spitting) Yeah, just another dream.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you characterize this as a positive encouragement, or perhaps a more negative reinforcement?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think more the latter. I don't feel like my favor with old Uk'otoa is as choice as it once was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why do you think it's angry with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You remember I told you there were words that were repeated through these visions?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, but sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Given that, there were two new words. Three, maybe. I don't know. I'll have to go back and watch it on VOD.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the gods and goddesses of Twitter will remind you of all those words, within minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If only someone would draw it. It was laced with a threat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A threat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In my dream, it saw fit to crush me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, how do you feel, now that you're not dreaming anymore?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Better.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you ever feel like you're not going to wake up from a dream when you're in it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but here you are. I'm sure it would put greater strain and stress against you for not following its wishes if it could, but it didn't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if it can?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why hasn't it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. One thing I am sure of, though: it feels stronger. It feels more present, closer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I'm proud of you for maintaining your sense of self through all this. It's difficult sometimes when one is pulled by things greater than ourselves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said you commune with the Mother.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a two-way thing, or are you just putting yourself out there and seeing what comes back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very much a two-way thing. There's no way-- nature isn't separate. We're part of it. We communicate with the world every day, with every breath. Everything we do is our declaration of our love, adoration, or our denial of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think she cares about the affairs of something like this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very much so. Without a doubt. I mean, I'm here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm getting the feeling that, maybe, if I do nothing, like any kind of disease, it might get worse. Maybe I should start thinking about a counteragent.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that what you want?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe. My dreams are one thing, right? I kick some dirt on the vomit and spittle. That shit is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It looks uncomfortable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's real. So I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's worth thinking about. I think there will come a day where you really will have to make that choice. We'll help you with that choice, whatever it ends up being. I do think you're on a path; and I don't necessarily think it's the path of just being a servant to some creature. I'm very impressed, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll cook something if you need to put that in-- a lot came out of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I'll be fine. I'm just going to crash back out, if you don't mind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no problem. I may have to tell the others in the morning, just for safety's sake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I turn over and try to go back to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of the evening is relatively uneventful. A full night's rest is achieved by the party, as restless as you may have been through most of it, Fjord. You all come to consciousness in a colder morning than the ones you had previously endured out here. It seems in the wake of the recent rains, you see a gentle frost that's beginning to coat the nearby horizon in a sprinkle of white shards of ice. As soon as the dome fades, you can see your breath emanate and dissipate into the atmosphere around you with each exhale. You find yourselves bundling up a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask, as the morning comes, am I sore? Is there any bruising, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Checking yourself, there's no physical bruising. There is a bit of soreness, but it seems to be relegated directly to the central abdomen, where the heaving would have come from. Nothing that correlates with the end of your dream.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (exhaling) You can see your breath. It's nice to have something familiar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's funny. Everyone said that Xhorhas was very ugly, but looking out, it kind of looks like a field of diamonds right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's glistening. Just like in that smut book you gave me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! It all comes back to the smut. Thank you, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that you have an interest in seafaring, so did you learn a lot?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Name three parts of a boat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. The port side, the poop deck, and the mast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are a silly goose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you okay, Fjord? You look weird.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, everyone's so attentive this morning. Nobody needs to get ready?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in a bubble.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's room!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The bubble has faded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had, as I've told Ducey here, another dream.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A wet dream?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not wet. There was moisture.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was pretty wet, actually. It was an extremely wet dream.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. The distinction is important.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a big puddle right over there from it. I don't-- I mean, why wouldn't you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, I had another wet dream.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: More of the same, or what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kind of. The previous dreams were more encouraging, like telling me to go forward and help it. This one felt a little more upset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because you're not in the water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think because we're not trying to let it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you at all nervous what will happen as we proceed towards the Kryn Dynasty?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it's been a while since my last dream. They're not super fun, so if that's the regularity in which I have to experience them, I guess I'll just deal with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you mean? He seemed unhappy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it was the first time that old demi-snake-god killed me at the end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, you don't know that that's necessarily-- that could be something else in your life that is troubling you that you manifested in a dream, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, stress.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you stressed about anything else?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Weaving itself together with this connection you have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Usually, work stress can make bad dreams. Are you having any stress at work?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is our work, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not particularly. I mean, other than giant rocs and bugbears--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sometimes when you get a new supervisor or something, that can affect it. Now that Caleb's in charge, is that affecting your general mood at all?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Hold on a second. Different topic. Why do you keep doing this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am not in charge of this group. I don't want to be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should be. No offense, you're clearly the smartest, and possibly the only smart one of us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm really smart, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Super duper smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau is right here, okay? Just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, are you calling me smart, or dumb?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're hard to read, sometimes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no, a tusk!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He spits a couple chunks of tooth out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am good with numbers, and with puzzles,

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Directions, memories.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Decision-making is a little questionable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have seen some excellent, excellent decision-making. The Wall of Fire on the boat was brilliant! It was a stroke of tactical genius.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, Nott, to answer your question, I think Caleb is a fantastic leader. Also Beau, or Jester, Yasha, Caduceus-- almost anyone in the group except you. (sniffs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, shots fired.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think you would make a great leader, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Jester. I appreciate that, but you're wrong. It's Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think we have a leader, really.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we all have our strengths here. We're all good at certain things. So, you know-- we don't need to keep on that tack. We're working together now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I understand, and I will leave it alone for now. Aye aye, commander.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Commander? That feels worse. Do we have to call you commander, now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can call me--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Admiral Widogast!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb Widogast is my name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a made-up name. You made it up on the spot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The way that I am smiling and blushing right now is what Caleb does, and he just walks away from the group to take a breath, and not look anyone in the eye.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, some of the smartest people that I know? Also terrible leaders.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Holla!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does that mean? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a cultural thing. You wouldn't understand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got to do that. It might be the new "bidet."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We have a decision to make, and seeing as how our leader has walked away temporarily, let's put this to a more democratic vote. We have two options in front of us. Sort of two-and-a-half. We can either charge across the plains towards finding my kidnapped husband in Ghor Dranas, find him, rescue him, have a happy reunion, all is good. Lots of unknowns in that scenario. Or, we have a job offer--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm, multiple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From Lady Zethris, to do some work for her in the city, which would give us, maybe, the financial means that would help us in our journeys ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or a favor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or a favor. Which, fingers crossed, maybe she could just organize the release of my husband, and we don't have to do the second part.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But how would we tell her that he needs to be released, and not make it like, "Oh, that's my "husband, from the Empire." (gasps) Okay, we're not in the city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. But what would it matter? If we earn a favor, I take her at her word. She would have to give us a favor, regardless of why we're asking for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, did she seem to place any conditions on this favor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, no. But she also-- she's in charge, and we're not. She could do whatever she wants.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not a very good favor, though, for endangering our lives for her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, no. But if you're like, "I'll give you a favor," and then somebody cashes in and they're like, "Oh, in order to cash in, you have to cut open your hand, and put it on this thing, "and maybe do some really horrible blood oath," would you do that as a favor? I mean, no, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I turn around and walk back to my spot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who are you dealing with? That's a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: People like, bleed into the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was a very specific hypothetical.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just saying. Some people, they do weird things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also, you know, the more time we spend here, the more we assimilate a bit. Maybe we'll get some allies. If we rush across, could be a bit hasty. We might jeopardize the whole thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll probably stick out less if we make a few friends and figure out how this place works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stopping here, we've already got some steeds waiting for us, if we're successful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to do our practice, right? Bounder practice? Then maybe we could ask about Lady Zethris's reliability, her trustworthiness. If people vouch for her, like, "She always does her "favors," or whatever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does she have a lot of business in Ghor Dranas?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, is she connected with the-- I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, as I have not made food this morning, because we're close enough to a town, we should probably grab some food and otherwise, because I'm trying to stock up for keeping people healthy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This sounds like a decent course of action to me. My one concern, not a dealbreaker, but I feel like we should continue to check in with Nott's husband, but I don't know how far exactly we are from him. I think it is a good idea to try to curry favor, and not rush headlong into we-don't-know-what. But what happens if you check in with him, and they are going to take him to the chopping block? I don't know. I mean, what happens then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to go right away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are a very long way away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then we let our favor be known before we finish the job.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She probably has something like Sending, too. Or like somebody that could send a message like I can send a message. Like I could send a message through her person--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe she's so powerful she can-- boom-- teleport us there, or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right, some people can do that. I forgot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Regardless, I feel like we have to gain her trust a little bit first. I don't think we should say anything about your husband until we at least do-- what? It seemed like there was a job, and then a harder job? A kind-of-easier job?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. we should come up with something other than he's your husband.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Pitch me. I'm a goblin and he was my--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your servant!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have a blood debt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I need to collect it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, ooh! He's your goblin husband, that was reincarnated as this stupid halfling, and you hate halflings!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, boy. This is a stretch!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But maybe you could get him back and turn him back into a goblin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, that is a compelling storyline. If I had met a character like that, I would fall in love with that character, and want to protect it with my life.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What if we are a group of mercenaries who have been sent here to collect this gentleman and bring him back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's simpler. That's much simpler.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like that. I mean, it's also not that far from the truth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We know that the Kryn have been pulling a lot of people for experiments. We could just say, "Not today, Kryn."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not foreign agents or anything like that; we're not invested in this fight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I know anything, wars are muddy. They're hazy. People have their credos they stick to, but things go against the grain often enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: People have to live their life in the middle of this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the right amount of coin, or for the right amount of favor, anything can happen, despite a war.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we prove to be helpful in this small instance, then perhaps she'll understand that we just have our own needs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We haven't used the dodecahedron and the stand together, right? We're assuming that those two things make it even more powerful?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we just gave them the stand, in exchange for him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're talking about giving up the tripod for old Yeza.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right; you need them both to be what we are assuming is incredibly world-changing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a plan C or D, right? We're just going to ask for a favor first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perhaps.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just forwarding it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you just say "I'm just Fjording it out?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just forwarding it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because please don't use your name as a verb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll Fjord you later for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You will Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the meantime, I think that we should acquire these beasts, get the training we need, in case we need to bug out of town as quickly as possible. Do we know what this woman has in mind, or do we need to return?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, the two missions were as follows. for 5,000 gold pieces, we must root out an Empire spy in the Quadroads-- nope, Four Corners. Wrong campaign. In the Four Corners. Find this Empire spy and throw them to the wolves. Or, for 10,000 gold or one favor, we must find the source of those rifts that we saw, the rift to the fiendish plane. The Abyss? The Abyssal Plane? We must find the source of these rifts and shut it down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Option number two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go big or go home.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, we are talking about the favor, which is not an option for the lower amount?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was not an option for the lower amount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they have any leads or anything to help, or are we on our own for that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The only lead was for the lower amount, the spy. She gave us a location. For the rifts, no leads.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She said that's a good thing that we are such good detectives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wouldn't mind doing both jobs. I'm curious as to who this spy is in general.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wouldn't either, but what if it tugs on certain party members' heartstrings, right? What if that spy is actually somebody that we're like, "Oh, that's a good person, and we're going to hand "you over for your death."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we've been presented with two opportunities. I'm sure that leads will manifest, and we'll follow whatever leads manifest. That will be what we're supposed to move towards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We just show up with results, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking A.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we find the person they are looking for, and it is someone that we do not want to hand over, we do not have to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who does multiple missions at the same time? Only jackasses would go and take both job options at the same time in one outing, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Subcontractor life? I don't-- it makes sense to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Gentleman. We did that before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, yeah. Let's go get some breakfast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When is the last time you checked in with Yeza?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remember last night, just before bed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's right.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: (warbling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll allow it.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yeah! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What should I say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, general update. Any sort of markings, or have you been-- where are you? Where the fuck are you?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, what if-- okay. I didn't mark my long rest, so that's good. I'll see how many spells I have.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If there is any chance, one of these times-- even if it is not today-- he is alone and feels that he can speak, maybe ask if he knows what they intend for him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, yes. I'm going to do that for sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do that first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, yes. What do I do? Just go, "Hey, are you alone? Can you speak? Because I need to ask "you some questions."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Assume that he's alone and can speak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, cool. Hi.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was the kickoff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck me! Please say "so" next, or "like."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, like, um... Hey, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: I mean.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh Jesus. Saving husbands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, internet!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any prominent markings around you? Do you think you'll be alone anytime? Do you know what they have planned for you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holla! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holla at you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeza's voice comes through quietly and whispered. "They're keeping me in a dark cell."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're keeping him in a dark cell.

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: "Underground somewhere. No interrogations yet."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know what they have planned."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't know what they have planned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Holla... back?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, what's up! He said holla back!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Did you hear his masculine voice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so manly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He is. He has the deepest voice in town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I could tell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's good! He's alive. Then they haven't roughed him up or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They literally just have him there, and they haven't asked him anything. Oh, I should ask if he knows why they took him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tomorrow morning, I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can send again. I can call him again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, go ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, one more time. Hey Yeza, do you know why they took you? Nott misses you so much. Keep those spirits up. Have you heard of the Traveler? Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know who Nott is, but hi."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you still coming?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no. What'd he say?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Number one, he said he thinks it's because he's working with the Assembly; that's why they took him. He's been working with the weird box thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was before, yes. Wait. Box thing. We only saw the tripod where he was, so he--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good night!

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS
lines.text: (warbling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As they relay this information the following morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so hungry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably get going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather your things. Are you guys taking on the same guises as you did the day before?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should disguise ourselves again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going in like myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going in straight, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Normal Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I'm going to go crazy, deranged human this time. I don't want to have to keep burning people's spells just to walk around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll see if it works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I flip my cloak inside out on the boring side. Hide the coat. Roll around in the dirt. Mess up my hair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put some makeup on to actually look goth, but my clothes are still boring me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take some eyeliner and black out a couple teeth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau looks significantly crazed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Caleb? What are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I repeat yesterday. I look like a male version of Jester, not very goth. I take a bit of tallow and powdered iron, and rub it together, and I smear it down the side of Beauregard's face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You did what? What is that? What'd you just do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You look good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did he do? What did you do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put some shit on her face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's bat droppings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not bat droppings. It's just iron and wax. Would you like some bat droppings?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm-- actually, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go into the right pocket. Here. It smells a little bit, but it-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark in your inventory, bat droppings. Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not all of my bat droppings, just a significant amount.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Not

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Saving that for later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Preparing your things--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got to find that minotaur.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They give a brief stink eye to both Yasha and Beau as they do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hello, friend!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no! Don't talk!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) "Stupid human!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was almost bad. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You come upon the familiar parts of the city, passing the goblin district, passing by the various other buildings and huts and hovels. Are you heading straight to Zorth's first?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that we should do that. I think we should get that knocked out of the way in case we need to leave in a hurry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You approach. You can see from the outside the familiar pen that is built around it. You hear growling, and two of the goblins are currently holding down the sides of one of the moorbounders, and a third one that's coming up and gingerly trying to feed it. As it brings its hands up, it throws a bunch of chunks of meat on the ground that slam into it and tumble over themselves before they release the creature. It starts drastically eating and throwing chunks everywhere. The goblins immediately scatter to the edge and close and lock the door behind them on the inside. As you guys enter, the slight little bell (jingling) as you push open the door, and you see the familiar older goblin face of Zorth there in the process of gathering harnesses and a few somewhat rough-looking but functional saddles. Turns around and notices you all and goes, "Oh, hello! It's "good to see you all! Did you sleep well?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did, we did, Zorth. So well some of us might appear different to you, but it's all of us again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a confusing statement, but sure, it's fine, now come on in here and learn how to ride!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, yes, yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, are these lessons taught by you or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're ready. I want to feel the thunder between my legs! Let's do it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you not need-- when riding these creatures, do you-- never mind, let's just see this lesson.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can only imagine probably ten feet or more. As soon as you begin to approach the edge you can see them all tense against the chains and (growling).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good, good deal, good deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We want these?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, we've got three of you. Three of you's going "to be learning how to ride these things. Could you please tell me who it's going to be?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that's one!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, me! And me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two! And three! All right, so we're going to bind you to your respective creatures, so be "ready. Who's up first?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am the cat person in this group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the three of you that are going to be learning, it's going to be a few hours. This is essentially an individual-- for each of you-- skill challenge that's going to require a series of animal handling checks. If there are any spell preparations you would like, you're free to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anyone want to look into the dodeca?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we should Bless!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bless does not affect skill checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the dodeca.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take the dodeca.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who has a low animal handling modifier?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got a good one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a good one, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, it's okay. I am comfortable with cats.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, is there nothing we can do? I mean, Enhance Ability, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be a way to do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I don't have that prepared.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then it's not going to help you. So Caleb, you first. The first aspect of the training is trust exercises, getting the creature comfortable with you, with your scent, and beginning to see you as an equal, or a leader, or a master of whatever your pact with it is. Zorth explains this in a cavalcade of various, somewhat obtuse descriptors, but you get the gist of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While he's doing that, Frumpkin-- I bring him to my shoulder and I have him start to pee subtly on my shoulders and hang out there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that familiar urine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Famili-urine? It slowly soaks into the shoulder. Zorth kind of, "It's--I would-- you-- "anyway!" Continues on. Make your first animal handling check as you begin to first approach and Zorth begins to help you with communion with this creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Clerics on standby, clerics on standby!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Caleb! Come on, Caleb!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've got this, Caleb!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good boys all around, hey? Kitty, kitty, kitty, kitty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, show that pussy who's boss!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is an 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It takes a bit of time, and there are a few withdrawings of your hands, but then eventually there is a moment where it seems to enable your touch. It begins to smell you, and Zorth begins to take the tether with one foot and pull it over and down so its head is below yours, and telling you to rub the top of its head and make eye contact. There's a whole ritual to this that seems to deal with a dominant position over the creature and a point of trust. In a weird way you gain-- for as crazy as the instruction of Zorth is, there's a renewed level of respect for the process that this goblin seems to have mastered, whether trained or on its own.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do feel that a bond does come with the creature, tenuous as it may be. Now, for the other two, I need you to also go through the same process.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask, as Caleb is standing next to these moo--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moorbounders.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Moorbounders. Where do they come up to us, height-wise, from their backs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Height-wise, their shoulders, which is the highest point of it, the sloped front all the way to the rear of the creature, the height, which is the shoulder, would be almost a foot taller than you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, how tall are you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six and change. These are big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the shit! I was picturing littles!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had the whole--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holy fuck, these are huge!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, these are big creatures.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm pretty tall, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: New mental pictures for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of them are a little smaller, some are a little bigger. You get a sense that there are variations in their age, and from what little information you got from Zorth before, the ones that survive, survive because they weren't eaten by the others. They're big creatures. That's also why they're expensive and utilized as war beasts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's pretty cool. We've got war beasts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Skeletor's was the panther one? Panthor, thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the first thing that popped into my head last week was Panthor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beau, Beau, Beau!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here, watch Nugget. Nugget, stay here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as Nugget is passed over towards Beau, you see the four tethered moorbounders (sniffing, growling).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They can understand me, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your animal handling check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm Doctor Dolittle, motherfucker.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) "I'm Doctor Dolittle, motherfucker!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so bad, but it's 11, like Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, okay. Similar process. The bonding takes a little while, but eventually the moorbounder that's brought to you-- a little bit smaller than the one that Caleb had, but still probably about six foot at full shoulder height, it's a thing you have to climb onto-- seems to come to a point of tenuous trust.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He loves me!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tattoo him!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, so I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strangely, you get the smallest of the three.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to be friends.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a clown on a tricycle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It comes up and (sniffs), and head butts your palm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aww, hey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second portion of this is going to involve being able to give commands and being able to have it-- beyond just being a beast that essentially-- what's the word I'm looking for-- endures your presence, it'll actually, actively, possibly take some commands. Beginning with you, Caleb, again, Zorth begins to show you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actively, possibly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still working with beasts here. Shows you, "All right, some of these creatures, you're "supposed to make sure that it not only trusts you and respects you but, possibly, given the "situations, it can also do things for you? Come on, try it out!" Make another animal handling check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. (singing) I like chicken, I like liver, Meow Mix, Meow Mix, please deliver. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over the next period of time, as the other people start getting ready as well, there gets to be a modicum of your voice causing its-- it doesn't even have ears that perk up more than it has these skin flaps that cover the side ear holes behind its bulging eyes. You can see where they twitch and turn and whenever you begin to make the simple commands of "jump." That's about as far as you get. Maybe down the road there could be other ones, but it begins to perk up at the sound of your voice, and you watch as--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halt

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can offer the commands "halt" and "jump."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jump?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two as well, same process.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got this, Jessie!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, of course, he loves me, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're great with animals and people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see it look you over. What do you command it to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (slurps) and it licks up the side of your cheek.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, that'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a thick saliva that seems to tingle the outside of your skin, but it is not listening to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's so cute. I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hard to be mad at it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can't tell you no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the third and final round that's going to refine that process, Caleb, make your final animal handling check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, all right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a cat person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed, and as part of that, whenever you make those commands to it, you get to make the roll with advantage. So keep that in mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good, that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What were the commands again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halt und

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, halt and jump.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just like Red Dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You as well manage to succeed in this process. While the two of you are with flying colors, all of a sudden there's a very, very faint beginnings of a bond with these moorbounders, you look over at Caduceus, who's having a little bit of a rough time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm having fun!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of the other two that seem to be a little more hunter, predatory ones, Caduceus got paired with one that seems a little more playful-kitten-like. It's the youngest of all of them, which also makes it a little hard for it to pay attention. Make your final animal handling check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Caduceus, you got this!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That succeeds, so you've earned the ability now to at least give these commands, but you do not gain the advantage as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we haven't gained the commands, would they have taken off fucking running, never come back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would've meant that they-- you don't know how they act. You could've got them going, but getting them to stop was going to be a very interesting experience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do, to be fair, have the spell Command, so worst-case scenario--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Worst-case scenario, you have that at your disposal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can actually give a one-word command to mine, and it'd be forced to obey me at least.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You would never do that to us, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we would have rolled really well on the first roll, would we have to even do the checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It was a growing DC with each check to see how well you bonded in this first three-hour session with the creature. Completing it, Zorth looks around at all of you. "I'm not going to lie, "I'm really impressed. That was amazing. Obviously, I've been doing this for a very long time, and I "haven't seen anyone bond quite that quick. That was incredible. Really blown away. That was "incredible. Well, I'll go and get my boys. We'll get these all suited up and ready to go."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Zorth, what are they called? What are these called? Do they have names, these creatures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not my prerogative. They're moorbounders. You get to name your beasts; you "bought them. Which, by the way, where's your coin?"

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much was it? 500?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it was 400? 300? It was 600.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was 600?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was 600 plus a dick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought it was 500.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a good deal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it? Or was it--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 600 and a dick statue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which he has, I'm sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You've already given the dick statue, which is sitting on the edge of the table at the front where you saw him handling things. He's very proud of its display. It's central to the arrival process.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will admit, I do want an insight check. Did we actually do better than most people, or is he just being very, very nice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an 18. Okay, okay. I'm into it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond. We have the new overlay, guys. I haven't seen it because I can't watch this show, because I'm on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's great. We built our overlay so it doesn't interact with their overlay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How'd we do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. (laughs) We did great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have 270, so I don't mind tossing in a hundred gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could toss in a hundred.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have these two jade stones. They're worth a hundred each. I will contribute them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm coin-light.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am coin-light, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can put in a hundred.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the total, six?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can put in 200 if we need to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're at 500 now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's Yasha? How's Yasha look on coin?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How does she look on coin?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I may have been forgetting to put money in her shit. Nope. No, she's got stuff. She can go for 50. We'll both put in 50.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe Yasha should pay for the whole thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha's good to put down a hundred gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha grips the handle of The Magician's Judge and looks at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the tally here? Two from me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you okay to part with these jade baubles?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at this cat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but he might only take coin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These are worth at least 150 each, but I will give them to you as part of this deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reaches the foot out--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's one. Oh, here. Both of them for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then hops over to the front desk and pulls out a small eyepiece and looks through, and is like, "Hmm. Hmm!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't forget, it's his foot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. I'll take it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's 200 right there? Wait, is it 300 or 200, Zorth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You said it was...?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 150 each. That's what I said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 150 each? Okay, I'll allow it. I thought you said a hundred originally.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that. I'm lying, Matthew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you--? Then it is 200, yeah? Or are you going for it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm lying to this armless goblin. Not to you because you know everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. That is a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "These are some pretty nice gems, not going to lie. Pretty nice. Pretty shiny. Nice and pretty "little baubles. 100 gold each."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Deal. Deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's 200.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: I'll put in a hundred.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hundred. That's everything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fantastic! You want them now? I can go and get them ready to go."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do these beasts eat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pretty much whatever you put in front of them that was once living. Meats, leathers, "jerkies, critters."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to keep them away from the animals, or at least--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about more intelligent fare? Someone like me? People, elves?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like those of us that didn't go through your seminar. Is it going to eat our faces in the middle of the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not as long as you keep them fed. If you're not feeding them, maybe not be sleeping near them, "if you know what I mean."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got any muzzles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, why-- what a dumb question. I don't know what I was thinking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or the saddle, so it's pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Saddles at the ready. You can take them now, if you want to bring them through the city, or--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can be held on to, until you wish to take them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that's better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk forward, I place my hand on the neck of my largest beast, and say, I will be back for you later, Jannik. Good boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jannik? All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halt

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What will you say to yours?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will be back for you later, Yarnball.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) Yarnball?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jannik, Yarnball...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (huffing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've got a theme going here, Caduceus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yandi's already been taken.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the theme? I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got Jannik and Yarnball, but you be you. You do you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yandi is an alpaca in another dimension.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yuduyu is a good name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so confused about the theme.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (snuffling, snort)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jannik, Yarnball, and Clarabelle have been decreed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so cute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. That's my sister. She's weird, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You named your moorbounder after your sister?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, does the moorbounder remind you of your sister? Or does your sister remind you of the moorbounder?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not entirely sure what the difference is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a fair point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. "So, pick them up when you're ready. We'll keep them until then. But, a couple "days later, if you don't show up, I'm going to have to assume you're not picking them up, and "they're back on the market."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a place around here that-- free trade of information-- like a pub or a central hub of--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Breakfast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --breakfast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where Barron's Meats is, big old butchery."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ms. Nott, you also wanted to inquire at some point about the character of our employer?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I didn't know if-- Hey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Zorthy, what's the word on the street about this Lady Zethris Oleos?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, she's spooky, that one."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spooky, like you can't trust her? Or spooky like you can trust her, and that's a bad thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. She's just very-- she's a lot! She's very pretty, and she's surrounded by a lot of "people. And very powerful. It's just I don't really go mingle with them political folk so much. So--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she come down from her tower much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They go back and scramble to go ahead and start feeding the rest of the moorbounders in the pen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are a lot of people scared of her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't-- maybe? I don't know."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Hey man, I have a question!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, what is the question?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you seen a lot of other places that have, like, the rifts like you had in your store? Have you heard of anything? Any other goblins talking about, "Oh man, you should have seen these "things that came out of this slit."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything strange going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll be back to collect our beasts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You'll be really happy."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That could have gone much worse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whew. Good job.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm proud of you all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now, Jannik is number two cat. You are number one. You are in charge. You just... dress to impress, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think Jannik has more, you know, constitution than number one cat?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think he puffs into glitter when he's punted? (chuckles)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He does not have half the heart as my cat, thank you very much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, but half the constitution for sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: General notes for moorbounders, just so you have them. This is their stats sheet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (imitating Zorth) Yeah, pass it down! TALIESIN & SAM: Ooh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to take a picture.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put it in my little creature notebook.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hate to insist, but can we please get some food? I'm fucking starving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am hungry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we make our way over to the Scowl Square?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Certainly. Continuing on into the center of the town, you pass by the Aurora Hold tower, where you guys had previously ventured. The guard, well placed. There's a lot of in and out of the facility as different Kryn soldiers or generals are in the process of whatever transition is happening to the western side of the city. Moving on and asking a few questions, you eventually find yourself at the Scowl Square. It's this large cross-point where two of the major roads meet, and a series of small alleys all come to an asterisk-looking center point, a little ways north beyond where the Aurora Hold was. Here in this space, there's a center patch of grass: a dull, dark gray-green grass and a singular tree. Around this, there are small tents and tables set up, with people that have gathered a number of roots or other hardier plant life that you had seen being harvested outside, in baskets and bags to be sold to whoever's passing by, or traded for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Farmer's market?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasionally piercing a finger while not really paying attention, then getting caught halfway through and having to undo it, and unstitch her own finger. You do see a barn, this large L-shaped barn on the northwest side of the square, but it has a sign hanging out front that says "Four "Corners". There's a smokestack, a space for a kitchen on the outer left side of the structure, little bit of smoke coming up. The door is part way open, and there's a bustling tavern on the interior. Looking around, you make a perception check for me, if you don't mind. You as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 16. Rolling middle-y today.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it. Fucking piece of shit: eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And actually, Jester, you as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay! No! I think that's like a 10.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. This is just a wide variety of salespeople around here, but a lot of it just seems to be general goods, scattered around. You do see there are a few places that have at least names attached to them, some of the huts or nearby buildings, those seem to be more prominent businesses here. It's unique. Having been in a lot of the central Empire cities, this city seems to be trying to build or create a semblance of that same type of civilization, but has a unique roughness to it that is both charmingly rustic and laced with a perpetual sense of danger. You do see there is a craft store that you heard mentioned before called Timoch and Ude Make Things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Timoch and Ude?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Timoch and Ude Make Things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds like an Etsy store.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tim and Eric make a movie?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over in that direction. You can see a small banner of cloth that is haphazardly painted that says "Madame Musk's."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, you're an interesting ivy. You local?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you hitting on the ivy, Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I mean, it's just that this is a surprising plant to find out in the middle of nowhere.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still sounds like he's hitting on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it does.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Are you local? Surprising to find you here."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What brought you here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Been here long?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fancy crossing paths.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come with anybody?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like ships in the night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're uncertain of the origins, because they've all mainly been torn of skin, and are just hanging sacks of meat carcasses that are up on hooks, hanging in a window display. There is an ogre in a nice, silk shirt with a ruffle across the neck and shoulder area, that is in the process of carving through, and preparing, large slabs of meat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do any of the hanging carcasses look like the things that we killed in the basement recently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably have to get a closer look to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to head in that direction. I'm going to just veer right off that comment to the butcher.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnoll goes up and makes its order. As you're keeping an eye out, make a medicine check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 28. Natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Had to happen eventually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at the structure of the various corpses that hang from the front of this establishment, none of them match the creature that you had fought the day before. Most of them seem to be either aurochs that you'd seen kept as beasts of burden in the area; deer--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing unusual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The meat itself is a little darker and looks a lot tougher.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Makes sense.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Too early.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnoll's packages are completed and sent off. The ogre sits back and takes his hands and puts it in a basin of water and wipes it and looks over at you. "We-- er." Reaches into a pocket and pulls out a monocle. "I haven't seen someone like you around. What's this about?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, my apologies. I'm not local, and I'm just very impressed by your operation and honestly, I was just curious what kind of animals you butcher here. We were on the lookout for some unusual creatures that might have been popping up lately. Things that don't necessarily belong here, or shouldn't be around here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well... I mean, it's meat."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What was your name again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My name is Baron Visco."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Baron Visco.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Baron's Meats.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A fine establishment you've got here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the natural 20 you rolled, you also notice that while the meats up front look very fresh, there's a smell that catches your nose of rotting meat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know the smell of rotting meat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you look past beyond it, and you can see there's a pile of spoiling meat just thrown in the far corner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's that pile for, back there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. There's been-- there's been issues."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, what kind of issues, if you don't mind me asking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, in recent weeks all the meat's been spoiling real fast, like."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That doesn't seem right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's odd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Having to raise prices. If you know anyone who is a hunter, we're paying for meat, "one gold piece by the pound."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you don't mind me asking, you don't happen to know where that spoiled meat came from do you? I mean, maybe there's a problem with the water source or something. I've got some talents of my own. Maybe I can help out a bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all from different sources."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are they all the same kind of animal? Or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But this is-- this is weird. Don't like it, not at all."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if I hear anything, I'll let you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please do. You buying something?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sadly, not for myself, but I will be back to buy something for a fr--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a tiny one."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sadly of a monastic tradition that does not allow me to consume the flesh of animals, so...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?" (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I eat plants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pfft. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're funny. Here." He cuts off a little bit and he tosses it to you. "Right size for your troubles."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, kind sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Eat it quick!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's meat!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what he said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a good idea, though, trying to track the meat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was hoping for a bit more, but the meat's going bad faster than it should, especially if they are salting it. It shouldn't go that quickly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it shouldn't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think it's worth checking in with the fish guy, see if fish have the same problem?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that a thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go over to that black dragonborn over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mosey up to his table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So many puns I'm not making. Carry on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You walk up to the dragonborn, massive shoulders. But you know, skipped leg day every time. He is sitting there throwing another fish over the line, and you can see there are fishing supplies off to the side. Sweating through the scales, the eyes themselves a very piercing sky blue, white iris. Glances over. "Aye, can I help you? You getting fish?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Just curious what you had, and what the catch of the day was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We got blue fish, we got red fish, we got gray fish. Gray fish are the bigger fish."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are the fish red, blue, and gray?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There are elements of the hue in there, where you can see that being the distinction he uses. You gather that this person isn't a fishmonger or master of the fish themselves, and has just probably started a couple of months ago catching fish and trying to sell them and isn't doing a very good job.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While Fjord is keeping him entertained, can I do a scan to see if there is a similar pile of rotted fish back there that he is having to discard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was painful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in the vicinity, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The tree that is behind him, does it look unusual? Medium-sized tree? Small tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see them occasionally, clusters of them across the fields, but they're pretty sparse. And the ones that you see are, at least for this time of year, leafless. Or are very hardy, swamp-type trees that endure very rough terrain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is the same true of grass? Is it more of a dead landscape around here, or have we seen grasses here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've seen grasses, but they are usually very thick, hardy, brown-gray grasses, scrub. A lot of scrubland-type plants here. Elements of what you would imagine in a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scottish moors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say Scottish moors meets Joshua Tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Does the tree look uncharacteristically healthy for the climate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't catch you as strange.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The tree's not giving off any bad vibes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The tree is the new chair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a one minus one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like, "That tree--" (sniff), and you smell the meat on your fingers and it completely distracts you, and you lose sight of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Salt. Fish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so fucking hungry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to go to this Timoch and Ude place, but-- Excuse me, do you know, where do these fish come in from? Are they river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, got them out of the Ifolon, that way, to the west. Ifolon. Ifolon River?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, yeah."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have any problem with rotting fish? I give him a little crazy eye, to go with my look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks down at you. He's a good foot taller than you. His snout puckers up a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just going bad a little too quick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe, I don't know. I sell a lot of them, really quick; I wouldn't know."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, no, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good luck with your haul.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You going to buy anything?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not doing too well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll make you hard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Madam Musk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Madam Musk's? Okay, what does she do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She makes musks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You head to the hut?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're trying it all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You build it, we're going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not going to buy anything. We're just going to go, insult you, and leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a giant head and torso, and these tiny little hands and tiny little legs. It's very creepy. It's almost like an old woman with baby proportions. It's upsetting when you approach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see her face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the hood is covering the face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello, hello, hello!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: MATT:"You've come to talk to Madam Musk?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, fuck this, let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so in. Yes, we have.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we have. We definitely have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What you looking for?" (creaking) She begins rocking in this wicker chair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm fucking out. I turn around. Somebody else take over!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grandmother, do you know much of this city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't wander it often, but I do know the land."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't like it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You tell fortunes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. But I make potions."

lines.name: SAM
